titles.title: Global Internet Freedom Act of 2003
A bill to develop and deploy technologies to defeat Internet jamming and censorship, and for other purposes.
Global Internet Freedom Act of 2003

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

term.name: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

bill.summary: Global Internet Freedom Act of 2003 - Establishes in the International Broadcasting Bureau the Office of Global Internet Freedom to develop and implement a comprehensive global strategy to combat state-sponsored and state-directed Internet jamming and persecution of those who use the Internet. Requires an annual report from the Office to Congress on the status of state interference with Internet use and of U.S. efforts to counter such interference. Expresses the sense of Congress that the United States should: (1) denounce governments that restrict, censor, ban, and block access to information on the Internet; (2) direct the U.S. Representative to the United Nations to submit a resolution condemning such actions; and (3) deploy technologies aimed at defeating state-directed Internet censorship and the persecution of those who use the Internet.
